About the job
Are you a talented Gambling Content Writer with knowledge and experience in the Gambling industry, with experience working on affiliate sites, looking to join a dynamic & forward-thinking Affiliate business aiming to expand its reach in these areas?

 At Finixio, we Value:

 Our Culture is:

Celebrate our success and learning from failures
Fun and supportive, where everyone is genuinely encouraged to be themselves
 Excited about this opportunity? Apply NOW!

job_title: Senior/Principal Product Manager, Connectivity Observability (Remote, United States or EMEA timezone)
name_location: Isovalent · EMEA Reposted  1 day ago  · 1,546 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Isovalent is the company founded by the creators of Cilium and eBPF. Isovalent builds open-source software and enterprise solutions solving networking, security, and observability needs for modern cloud native infrastructure. The flagship technology, Cilium, is the choice of leading global organizations, including Adobe, AWS, Capital One, Datadog, GitLab, Google, and many more. Isovalent has headquarters in Cupertino, CA (US) and Zurich, Switzerland (EU) and is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, Google, M12 (Microsoft), Grafana Labs and Cisco Investments.

The Community you will join:
Are you interested in working with the global open source community and enterprises worldwide to revolutionize network and application visibility using eBPF technology? We are looking for a Senior/Principal Product Manager, Connectivity Observability who is passionate about empowering customers with powerful visibility into the health of connectivity between modern API-driven workloads on Kubernetes. With this role, you’ll help guide our contributions to open source Cilium, which has become the default networking solution for Kubernetes distributions from industry giants like Google, Microsoft, and Amazon, as well as to our Isovalent Cilium Enterprise product.

About the role:
As the first Senior/Principal Product Manager, Connectivity Observability at Isovalent, you are the voice of the customer inside Isovalent. You will lead the vision and roadmap for connectivity observability solutions at Isovalent, giving customers rich eBPF-powered visibility into the health, performance, and failures of connectivity between applications, without sidecars. If you:
have learned the hard way that “It’s always DNS”.
have a deep understanding of L2-L7 network protocols, and how they can break
love creating observability workflows that help users quickly root cause issues.
have a desire to work alongside the most knowledgeable eBPF engineers in the world and build expertise in this exciting technology.
believe Kubernetes is the future of infrastructure and want to build your expertise.
are passionate about working with (and learning from) customers.
Then this is the role for you. To learn more about the power of eBPF-powered connectivity observability, please read our blog or try our Hands-on Lab.

 A typical day:
Work with customers to understand the challenges they face related to the health, performance, and failures of network connectivity for applications running on Kubernetes.
Define the product’s vision, build a roadmap, and write product requirements by utilizing your expertise in infrastructure observability tools and hands-on experience troubleshooting real-world network connectivity issues in large-scale environments.
Work closely with engineering on all the trade-offs involved with how we build the product, from understanding performance and scalability impacts of various designs to weighing in on product usability and workflows.
Stay abreast of the competitive landscape, mastering industry trends, insights, and best practices, while actively sharing this knowledge with the team and stakeholders.
Work with marketing to help clearly articulate the value and ROI for a new feature, helping to create demos, slides, and other materials that help sales & customers understand the value.
Work closely with customer success and sales to make sure that customers understand and are effectively realizing the vision of the product capabilities you have introduced.

Your Expertise:
Strong technical expertise and in-depth understanding of networking protocols (L2 through L7), including Ethernet, IP, TCP/UDP/ICMP, TLS, DNS, and HTTP
Demonstrated experience troubleshooting real-world network connectivity issues in large-scale environments, utilizing Linux command line and network tooling
3+ years of experience as a user or vendor of infrastructure observability tools, with a focus on delivering high-quality products and advocating for customers
Familiarity with Kubernetes and Kubernetes networking, preferably with hands-on experience delivering or running software on the Kubernetes platform
Expertise in the observability space, with a deep understanding of the industry landscape, trends, and best practices
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, enabling effective communication with both technical and non-technical audiences, and the ability to present and defend ideas
Strong bias for action, with a proactive and results-oriented mindset
Ideal qualifications include familiarity with eBPF, existing product management experience, and exposure to cloud networking concepts from major cloud providers (e.g., AWS, VPCs, ENI, ELB)

Who we are:
Isovalent is driven by a simple goal: Building amazing technology and making our customers successful with it. Beginning with our open source roots, building outstanding technology with a great team continues to be at the core of everything we do. We work every day to inspire our customers with our products and exceed their expectations. Beyond technology many Isonauts share a love of the outdoors, running, hiking, skiing, climbing and biking.

Our Core Values:
Remote First: We strongly believe in a remote-first philosophy. Our work and communication culture allows teams to be successful regardless of their location.
Mutual Respect: It is the cornerstone of our values to foster trust and create a safe space for growth and innovation and is at the heart of everything we do.
Open- Source & Transparency: Our culture is deeply rooted in Open Source principles. We thrive on openness, transparency, and inclusion.
Work & Adventure Balance: The work we do is very exciting and challenging. We encourage hard-work but also encourage our team to take the time needed to recharge and balance life. We are here to support each other in that personal balance.
Personal Growth: This means different things to each of us and at Isovalent, we are dedicated to supporting your unique growth objectives, whatever they may be.

Why should you join us:
At Isovalent, our continuous endeavor is to create an environment where our Isonauts can embrace their authentic selves. Central to our daily operations is a deep-rooted commitment to mutual respect. We value and honor diverse perspectives, actively listening to one another. As a globally distributed team spanning nine timezones, we embrace the richness that our diverse locations bring.

At our company, we prioritize the well-being, motivation, focus and creativity of our employees. With these objectives in mind, we have developed comprehensive wellness programs, tailored to their needs. We have cultivated a work environment that fosters a genuine love for what we do, and we believe you will feel the same.

Our benefits package varies by location and may include pension, 401K, health insurance and more depending on the country of employment. We prioritize company-wide offsites to foster team connection, cross-department collaboration, and time to strengthen our relationships and culture. We offer a Flexible Time Off philosophy, encouraging a minimum number of days per year for rejuvenation. Our Mental Health and Wellbeing program supports individuals in finding their own strategies for work-life balance through activities like mindfulness and yoga, complemented by employee support channels and a monthly stipend. We offer inclusive parental leave and provide competitive compensation packages tailored to each role.

Isovalent is committed to fostering a culture that celebrates diversity, inclusion and an authentic workspace. We understand that not everyone who applies from a more diverse background will meet all the requirements on day one. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway. Also, if you have a disability, please let us know if there’s any way we can make the interview process better for you; we’re happy to accommodate!

Please note that benefits vary by country. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to ask your Talent Acquisition Partner.

As part of the hiring process, Isovalent may conduct a background check through a 3rd party with an applicant’s consent. Result of any background check will be considered as part of the hiring process, but may not necessarily disqualify a candidate from employment.

Location: In this role, you can work remotely anywhere in the United States or EMEA timezone.

name_location: Spaulding Ridge · Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 45 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.

At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.

What You Will Do And Learn

We are looking for an Anaplan Consultant to join our Anaplan Delivery Team!

As an Anaplan Consultant, you will help some of the world’s most well-known organizations solve business challenges through Enterprise Performance Management. With the opportunity to build your Anaplan expertise by obtaining recognized certifications, you will implement Anaplan as a ‘Best in Cloud’ solution for Finance, Supply Chain and Sales.

The role

Interact directly with clients to extract their needs
Analyze customer needs, design, configure, and test customer solutions
Resolve technical issues through debugging, research, and investigation
Assist with production support issues as required
Maintain effective working relationships with team members
Mentor Analysts with domain knowledge and configuration questions
Assist with configuration reviews to provide useful feedback
Contribute to project and team documentation
Deliver Anaplan training to our clients
Stay current with latest Anaplan technologies and best practices within the industry


You have

4+ years of experience in Consulting or Financial Reporting and Analysis
Strong knowledge of Excel. Including an understanding of how to develop macros, and model large data sets utilizing Lookups and SumIf functions
Microsoft Office Suite expertise
Strong understanding of multi-dimensional data architecture 
Degree in Finance, Accounting, Logistics, and/or Management Information Systems preferred


We take care of you!

As an employee of Spaulding Ridge, you will part of a company that is providing innovative opportunities to impact our clients in a meaningful way. We believe giving back is core to our values and as part of this effort, you will be given the opportunity to participate in different opportunities throughout the year including SR’s day of service, giving back to our global community. Here are some our great perks and top benefits to highlight:

Competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, pension and accidental cover
Flexible Time Off
Paid holiday time
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Monthly technology, wellness, internet, and meal allowance
Annual training allowance program


Spaulding Ridge’s Diversity Commitment

When we engage the expertise, insights and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.

At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support DEI, and through our employee-led committees: CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, Women Ambassadors, Sexual Orientation and Gender Identity(SOGI) Alliance, and Community Outreach.

The company is committed to offering Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay ( challaday@spauldingridge.com ) Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

name_location: Bravida · Malmö, Skåne County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 64 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Vill du alltid bli lite, lite bättre och vara del av ett engagerat HR-team? Får du energi av omväxling och snabbt tempo i en föränderlig miljö? Hos oss får du frihet under ansvar att överträffa förväntningar genom din kunskap, ditt driv och ditt intresse. Nu söker vi en HR Partner till Division Syd i Malmö. 

Beskrivning av tjänsten

Som HR-partner är du delaktig i Bravidas utveckling och du kommer att ha en central och viktig roll i att stödja, driva och möjliggöra utvecklingen av våra verksamheter utifrån vår affärsplan. Du arbetar verksamhetsnära och agerar som affärsstöd till våra chefer när det gäller alla typer av HR frågor, samtidigt som du förväntas bidra i divisions- och koncerngemensamma projekt. Arbetet innebär arbetsdagar med stor variation och arbetsuppgifter som inkluderar:
Strategiskt och operativt chefsstöd
Employer Branding aktiviteter
Rekrytering
Rådgivare i arbetsrättsliga frågor
MBL-förhandlingar
Utvecklingsprojekt
Rehabilitering

Din profil

Vi söker dig som har bred erfarenhet av HR-frågor och som har ett positivt sätt, är engagerad, prestigelös och tycker om att ge service. Du som söker har akademisk examen som personalvetare eller motsvarande, med minst 5 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet. Du trivs i en roll med många kontaktytor och en bred variation av arbetsuppgifter. Resor ingår i tjänsten.

Som HR Partner i Bravida Division Syd, kommer du att ingå i ett team av sex HR Partners tillsammans med divisionens HR chef. Division Syd har cirka 3 000 medarbetare i åtta geografiska regioner. Vi söker den här gången efter en person som ska vara främsta HR-stödet till vår region Malmö. Vårt gemensamma arbetssätt i HR teamet kännetecknas av gott samarbete, stort eget ansvar och ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt. För att trivas i rollen är det viktigt att du tycker om när det händer mycket och har förmågan att snabbt växla mellan olika frågeställningar och utmaningar.

För att trivas och lyckas på Bravida behöver du:
Vara en serviceinriktad lagspelare. På Bravida jobbar vi gärna i team. Stämningen är öppen och vänlig och vi hjälps åt i jobbet.
Kunna leda dig själv. Det är medarbetarnas kunskap och drivkraft som gör Bravida till ett vinnande lag. Varje spelare är viktig!
Alltid sträva mot förändring till det bättre. Varje dag jobbar vi tillsammans för att bli ännu bättre på det vi gör. Vår högsta prioritet är att göra kunden nöjd.
Jobba med stil. På Bravida gör vi jobbet ordentligt. Då är det viktigt att komma i tid, att vara ärlig och lojal, och att hålla det vi lovar.

Bravida eftersträvar mångfald och värdesätter en jämn könsfördelning.

Vad erbjuds du?

Vårt erbjudande till dig är ett självständigt och stimulerande arbete i en organisation där kompetens, utveckling och trivsel värderas högt. Vi är vana att leverera högsta kvalitet till nöjda kunder och värnar om arbetsglädje likväl som en bra arbetsmiljö. Här kan du läsa mer om hur din utveckling hos oss fungerar. När du växer, växer vi!

Bravida har blivit rankade till en av Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare och detta är vi mycket stolta över. Vill du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss klicka här. Följ oss på Facebook!

Bravida är en ledande totalleverantör av installations- och servicetjänster i Norden, med fler än 12 000 medarbetare. Bravida levererar såväl specialisttjänster som helhetslösningar inom el, vs, ventilation, säkerhet, kyla, sprinkler, teknisk fastighetsdrift och kraft. Bravida finns representerade på drygt 150 orter i Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland. www.bravida.se

Ansökan

Sista ansökningsdatum för denna tjänst är den 22 oktober 2023.

Passar du in på profilen? Ansökningar hanteras löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum. Klicka på nedanstående länk för att ansöka till tjänsten.

I denna process undanbedes kontakt med rekryteringsföretag.

name_location: FMV - Försvarets materielverk · Arboga, Vastmanland County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 7 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Hos oss samlas specialister inom flera olika områden. Våra olika delar blir till helheter och vårt engagemang blir till leveranser. Det är så vi möter det svenska försvarets behov – i fred, kris och krig. FMV står just nu inför en otroligt stark utvecklingsresa där vi behöver fler engagerade medarbetare, vill du vara med på den resan?

ArbetsuppgifterSom projektledare är din uppgift att leda teamet i linjearbete. Det innebär att fördela och följa upp tilldelade uppgifter, vidmakthålla och teckna nya avtal med industrin samt lägga budget och prognos. Du kommer att stödja utvecklingen och implementation av nya regelverk och rutiner, sköta utredningar och analyser inom materialdata. I rollen ingår även att sköta samverkan mellan avdelningar internt, med Försvarsmakten och industrin.

Det kommer att finnas goda möjligheter att själv vara med och vidareutveckla denna roll och även utveckla och effektivisera befintliga processer.

Tjänsten är placerad i Arboga och resor i tjänsten förekommer.

Vi söker dig somÄr utbildad Civil- eller högskoleingenjör eller har motsvarande kompetens som vi bedömer som likvärdig. Du har en utbildning eller erfarenhet av att arbeta som projektledare.

Meriterande är tidigare erfarenhet om grund och förvaltningsdata, olika IT-plattformar, teamcenter eller Offentlig upphandling. Vidare talar och skriver du svenska flytande och har också en god förmåga att utrycka dig väl på engelska i både tar och skrift. Du har goda kunskaper i Officepaketet och vi ser det som en fördel att du har förståelse för budget eller prognosarbete.

Vi önskar att du har en god samarbetsförmåga och som projektledare är det även viktigt att du är självgående. Du drivs av att knyta kontakter och skapa goda relationer. Vidare har du ett strukturerat arbetssätt och har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.

Om oss 

Vi på verksamhetsområdet Logistik (VerkO Log) ansvarar för och organiserar verksamhet för att leverera produkter och tjänster inom logistikområdet. Verksamheten bedrivs i nära samarbete med andra verksamhetsområden inom FMV, Försvarsmakten samt externa leverantörer, där vi är en rådgivande expertresurs. Denna tjänst är placerad på enheten Materieldatastöd som ansvarar för utarbetande och implementering av myndighetsgemensamma arbetssätt, metoder och krav inom teknisk information och produktdata.

Vi erbjuder dig

På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.

Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?Sök tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Våra fackliga företrädare är SACO Per Andersson, OFR/S Peter Boström, OFR/O Henry Joona och SEKO Peter Andersson. Alla nås på telefon 08-782 4000 (FMV Växel).

Vid frågor om tjänsten ber vi dig kontakta Emma Löfling på telefon 08-782 4000.

Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen ber vi dig kontakta Johanna Forsell 073 684 71 65

Sista ansökningsdag är 2023-10-16.

Välkommen med din ansökan.

FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

job_description:
About the job
Är du självgående och har förmåga att ta egna initiativ? Vill du arbeta i kvalificerade projekt med syfte att bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi söker. 

Arbetsuppgifter

I din roll som chefsingenjör kommer du att erbjuda stöd, coachning och mentorskap för våra medarbetare. Du kommer leda arbetet med att säkra, utveckla och uppdatera våra processer, instruktioner, styrande dokument samt regelverk. I rollen ingår även att kontinuerligt arbeta för att utveckla samarbetet både internt mellan våra olika enheter och gentemot Försvarsmakten och industrin samt även verka i internationella forum.

I det dagliga arbetet ansvarar chefsingenjören för flera områden, bland annat föra dialog och avstämningar med intressenter, etablera och kommunicera processer samt vara kravställare och kravmottagare. Vidare kommer du stödja vid analyser och utredningar samt kvalitetssäkra FMVs underlag eller remissvar inför beslut.

Tjänsten är placerad i Arboga och resor förekommer.

Vi söker dig som

Är utbildad Civil- eller högskoleingenjör, militär officersutbildning eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt. Har du utbildning i systemutformning, ILS, konfigurationsledning, kravhantering eller kravspecifikation ser vi det som meriterande.

Dokumenterad erfarenhet inom materieldata eller erfarenhet från arbete med FMV eller försvarsmaktens materielprocesser ser vi som meriterande. Har du erfarenhet av tekniskt systemarbete, teknisk dokumentation eller erfarenhet av att arbeta inom en statlig förvaltning ser vi även det som en fördel.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och vi ser att du är initiativtagande och strukturerad i din yrkesroll. Du är samarbetsvillig och visar prov på gott omdöme i situationer som kräver det. Tjänsten innebär dialog med olika intressenter och det är viktigt att du kan utrycka dig väl såväl i tal som i skrift på både svenska och engelska. Du har även goda kunskaper i MS Officepaketet.

I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt.

På FMV jobbar vi aktivt utifrån utvecklande medarbetarskap, som är en modell för att utveckla samarbete, främja ansvarstagande och skapa engagemang för att ta tillvara på den initiativförmåga som vi alla besitter. name_location: Canonical · EMEA Reposted  1 day ago  · 1,134 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Our mission is to secure and manage Ubuntu on IoT devices globally. With billions of connected devices running Linux, we think the opportunity for Ubuntu is enormous, and we will need a high-performance, scalable management system to ensure they are healthy, up to date, and doing what they should be doing! Our device management and telemetry team is building a cloud-native solution for large-scale estate and fleet management, ultimately aiming to be the industry standard for devices of every category.

This is an opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and web services at scale.

Canonical’s engineering team are at the forefront of the IoT revolution. Ubuntu is the number one Linux for IoT, and with Ubuntu Core we have set the pace for device security. We are now working to expand our portfolio with industry-leading, secure, auditable and reliable telemetry services.

The right candidate will be part of the team that will provide the backbone to our expanding IoT market, enhancing both our on-prem offering as well as scaling to a global cloud-based platform.

What you’ll do
Collaborate with a globally distributed team.
Write scalable service APIs in Python and Golang to provide telemetry services.
Develop observability, remote logging, data acquisition, alert and notification, and edge processing capabilities
Work with our infrastructure team to develop both a cloud-based SaaS offering as well as a containerised local on-prem solution.
Design and implement new features and enhancements from spec to production at scale.
Review code and technical designs produced by other engineers.
Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions.
Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events.

Who you are
You love technology and working with a diverse set of talented people.
You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable.
You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated.
You have a broad technology base but favor backend code and infrastructure.
You have a good understanding of cybersecurity and the challenges of the IoT environment.
You have knowledge and experience of telemetry systems including data streaming technologies, observability and monitoring systems, and the application of security/IAM models to such systems.
You have proficiency in developing tooling and libraries, and the design and implementation of back-end web services, messaging/data pipelines, and REST APIs using python and/or Golang
You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform.
You have a Bachelor’s or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world’s best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu. Canonical is a unique tech company - global, remote-first, open source, with 1000+ professionals across 70+ countries. We want to be the world’s best, not biggest, global software company. With almost every team remote by default, Canonical sets the pace on the 21st-century digital workplace.

What Canonical offers:
Work from home
Learning and development allowances
Competitive Salary
Annual compensation review
Recognition rewards
Generous annual leave
Paid maternity, paternity and sick leave
Priority Pass for travel
Exposure to international business and technology

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.

name_location: Eaton · Gävle, Gavleborg County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 18 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Would you like to make a difference to the environment? Do you want to work for a global and ethical company? Join us and help us provide energy-efficient solutions that make a real impact. We make what matters work. To find out more about us check: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baa_aiJ4L7E

Job Summary

Eaton Electrical Services organization in EMEA is covering 25 countries with 500+ employees, being a fast-growing business responsible of life cycle management of all Eaton Electrical products, systems and software portfolio. We are serving customers in Data centers, Utilities, Industries, Buildings, Marine, Healthcare segments by providing installation, commissioning, warranty care, preventive maintenance, troubleshooting services, spare parts, equipment life extension, modernization and end of life services.

As a Project Manager (PM) you will be responsible to ensure the successful delivery of major projects for strategic customers in Gavle area, later in EMEA. Such projects are mainly for data centre fit out, but could include other types of large and complex projects requiring site works.

Eaton’s Data Centre projects can involve every aspect of power distribution from low to medium voltage, UPS (uninterrupted power supply), and automation such as EPMS (Energy Power Monitoring System). The PM brings electrical expertise, and as Eaton also offers DCIM (Data Centre Infrastructure Management) and SCADA systems, experience with automation is a definite asset.

The PM is expected to provide technical and customer knowledge leadership within the wider organization.

Job Responsibilities

Use modern project management practices and techniques to execute projects from PO to handover to service. This includes design engineering, procurement, and implementation of projects electrical and/or automation projects for critical infrastructure (e.g. Data Centres).
Take full responsibility for his/her assigned projects and bring them to successful completion using Eaton project management processes and tools, plus managing the people and resources who deliver the project. 
Identify, build, and maintain a project team. Organize kick-off then regular meetings, and ensure clear scope and understanding of deliverables for all internal (e.g. engineering, procurement, service) and external stakeholders (e.g. customers, end users, contractors, 3rd parties, subcontractors)
Provide regular reporting to both internal and external stakeholders to ensure common understanding of progress toward the project’s deliverables.
Own the project schedule: Build, maintain, and regularly update and communicate the project schedule for all assigned projects, including the required support resources to execute (e.g. FSEs, Engineering.)
Identify and maintain a risk register, while actively working to mitigate and/or eliminate potential problems.
Work with Eaton internal engineering teams to align on the definition of deliverables as per technical specification and customer requirements 
Provide design submissions and confirmations for the projects to the customer and wider community from initial design submissions through design confirmation following the customer processes. 
Manage the project margin by controlling costs, managing variations, and regularly report out the financial forecast and status as required. This includes managing and controlling costs for Eaton internal and 3rd party external support.
The PM provide hands-on leadership and single point contact for all on-site implementation work. This includes defining scripts such as for Site Acceptance tests (SAT) and providing direction and support for the teams doing hardware installation, software configuration, and on-site works.
The PM ensures that projects are successful in terms of all key metrics such as safety, customer satisfaction, financial performance (profitability, revenue and cashflow) and project execution timing.
Training/Transition: The PM will organize and often lead the customer (and internal) training at project closure, hand over to the Eaton service support teams, and do a full lessons-learned close out of the projects.
The PM may also be called on to provide occasion support for other sites where expertise is lacking to support customer needs.
Continually identify ways to improve the way Eaton execute projects and share learning. This may involve developing new initiatives and recommending better ways to work based on analysis and learning on sites as well as overall customer trends. 


Qualifications

Relevant project/site management experience plus an equivalent of hands-on site works in Data Centres is expected. Experience with other large and complex industrial projects will also be considered, especially if they included works in automation.
A strong electrical background and/or training on high end automation is highly desired. 
Bachelors’ Degree or Masters' Degree from an accredited institution with a strong preference toward electrical engineering is highly desirable.
Experience working specifically with Power Management, Power Control, Mission Critical, or Building Management systems is a plus.
Experience with Project Management of major capital equipment (ideally electrical) and experience in commercial construction and/or Data Centres a plus
A strong personal presence and proven ability to manage others is highly desirable.


We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for job applicants and employees. Our recruitment processes use balanced selection criteria and avoid unlawful discrimination against applicants on the basis of their age, colour, disability, marital status, national origin, gender, gender identity, genetic information, race or racial origin, religion, sexual orientation or any other status protected or required by law.

]]>

name_location: Kambi · Uppsala, Uppsala County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 24 applicants
job_description:
About the job
About Kambi
Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
Join our great Development Team at Kambi!
Are you ready to take your development career to new heights? Kambi Engineering is seeking a new talent to join our Uppsala-based team, and we believe you could be the perfect fit. Within Engineering we are nearly 400 globally committed individuals, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of the sports technology industry. Here's your chance to be a part of our success story!
What sets us apart from others is our unwavering focus on decentralizing decision-making and empowering teams to forge their own paths in problem-solving. We foster a collaborative environment where everyone supports each other in tackling complex challenges, making work not only impactful but also enjoyable. By joining our team, you'll contribute to our continued success and help shape the future of sports technology.
As a member of our team, you'll primarily work with Java and Kotlin, applying your expertise in developing, deploying, and owning business-critical systems. We take great pride in our commitment to clean coding practices, ensuring our products are maintainable and of the highest quality over the long term. Additionally, we operate as a DevOps team, meaning you'll have the opportunity to take full ownership of all aspects of our products and components.
To thrive in this role, we're seeking candidates who possess the following qualities:
Experience as a Developer, having worked in an agile team developing, deploying, and maintaining systems.
A demonstrated mindset and skill set that aligns with being an effective part of a cross-functional, self-organizing, and self-managing team.
The ability to write clean, well-structured, and readable code that adheres to best practices.
Proficiency in writing tests to validate the correctness of your code.
Fluent in English, enabling effective communication and collaboration.
In return for your exceptional skills and dedication, we offer a range of benefits and opportunities for growth. At Kambi, we invest in our employees' professional development and provide a supportive and inclusive work environment. You'll have the chance to work with cutting-edge technologies and tools, including:
Java/Kotlin
AWS
Kubernetes (K8s)
Apache Kafka
Spring framework
PostgreSQL
Git version control
Jenkins
IntelliJ IDEA
Grafana
Atlassian suite (Jira, Confluence)
What’s in it for you? 
An exciting role within an expanding, progressive department that just started its DevOps journey
An opportunity to work in a successful and fast-growing company
A fun and flexible working culture with lots of opportunities to grow together with your talented colleagues.
Learning and Development
At Kambi, we encourage learning and provide opportunities for our team members to develop their skills and knowledge. We offer internal trainings, participation in industry conferences, organize hackathons and other collaborative events. We believe that the best way to achieve our mission is to foster a culture of continuous learning and development.
If you're ready to be a part of our dynamic and innovative team, take the first step towards an exciting future by applying today with your updated CV in English.
Join Kambi Engineering, where limitless possibilities await. Let's shape the future of sports technology together!
#wearekambi
Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace
If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
Creating an inclusive environment
We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
#wearekambi

name_location: Prysmian Group · Nässjö, Jonkoping County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 48 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Prysmian Group Scandinavia AB är en del av en stor global aktör inom kabeltillverkning – Prysmian Group. Gruppen finns i över 50 länder och har 29 000 anställda. Prysmian Group är marknadsledare i tillverkning av elektriska kablar. Produkterna marknadsförs under de välrenommerade varumärkena Draka och Prysmian. Med innovativa lösningar hjälper vi våra kunder att överföra energi och information på ett effektivt sätt, överallt! Scandinavia består av Sverige, Norge och Danmark och i den svenska delen av företaget finns fabriken och huvudkontoret i Nässjö och där är vi totalt cirka 200 medarbetare.

Prysmian Group Scandinavia söker nu en Strategisk Inköpare

Huvudsakliga Ansvarsområden

Kategoriansvar för indirekt material
Skapa och implementera gynnsamma inköpsstrategier
Föra förhandlingar och upprätta avtal
Upprätta och kultivera existerande samt nya leverantörsrelationer
Hantering, uppdatera och säkerställa efterlevnad av avtal och kontrakt
Inköpsprislistor och inköpsanalyser
Sourcing/Anskaffning av indirekt material, tjänster
Leda initiativ till processförbättringar 

Din Profil

Erfarenhet inom inköp är självklart meriterande, men vi vill även ha ansökning från dig som saknar erfarenhet men som har ett genuint intresse för att göra affärer. Din personlighet och ditt driv kommer att spela stor roll i urvalsprocessen. . Då vi ingår i en internationell koncern har mycket kontakt med våra kollegor runt om i världen krävs att din engelska är mycket god i tal och skrift.

Som person är du driven, analytisk, engagerad och ansvarsfull. Du klarar av att självständigt hantera rollen som strategisk inköpare och uppskattar att arbeta med många funktioner i bolaget samt leverantörer. Du tycker det är spännande att göra bra affärer, är resultatorienterad och har god förhandlingsvana. Det är meriterande om du har viss juridisk kunskap.

Vi Erbjuder

Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i en internationell organisation med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter både lokalt och globalt. Utöver möjlighet att utvecklas har vi bra personalförmåner och fin gemenskap bland kollegorna. Kontakta oss för att få veta mer. Läs också mer om företaget här: prysmiangroup.com

Lockas du av utmaningen av en roll som Inköpare hos världens största kabeltillverkare?

Sänd din ansökan redan idag, urval och intervjuer sker löpande. Vid frågor kontakta Inköpschef Jimmy Ward, +46380 55 41 56 eller HR Professional Kristina Hellqvist, +46380 554090, kristina.hellqvist@prysmiangroup.com

Jobbtyp: Heltid, Tillsvidare, dagitd, arbete på distans erbjuds del av tid

Prysmian Group, as an Equal Opportunity Employer, aims to attract and recruit individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills and abilities, who will enhance the quality of service and contribute to the Group’s success. Prysmian Group is committed to the development of an organization that prioritizes talent, where people feel respected, appreciated and free to fully express their human potential. Prysmian Group strongly believes that diversity drives meritocracy and brings significant value at all levels of the organization, increases the possibility of capturing market opportunities and maximizing value for our customers and shareholders. Prysmian Group bases its decisions on principles of equality, with evaluations based on the type of position and with a focus on best practices so individuals succeed based on their efforts and skills and their alignment with applicable job requirements.

Line Managers, Hiring Managers, HR Corporate and HR Local are responsible for ensuring that diversity and inclusion are respected during the recruiting process. Unconscious bias and stereotypes must not influence our selection processes. We look for the best candidates and for the real value they can bring into the organization. We value meritocracy. We value diversity. We turn off our bias. All persons shall have the opportunity to be considered for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, military service and veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. Prysmian will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

Your application data will be treated according to our Data Protection Policy. If you believe you require assistance to complete this form or to participate in an interview, please let us know.

name_location: Implema AB · Göteborg, Vastra Gotaland County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Vi är ett av Sveriges mest spännande konsultbolag. Vi växer och söker dig som vill hjälpa svenska och internationella företag att utvecklas och bli mer hållbara. Hos oss arbetar du med de ledande affärssystemen från SAP och Microsoft, utvalda best-of-breed lösningar, och det senaste inom intelligent digitalisering, analytics och cloud. Implema ligger i framkant av digitaliseringsvågen, vilket kräver att vi vågar tänka nytt och tänja på gränser. Vi är prestigelösa, öppna och hjälpsamma – både internt och med våra kunder. Idag är vi drygt 200 anställda och finns på 10 orter runtom i landet.

Analytics Consultant SAP

Implema växer och söker fler erfarna konsulter inom SAP Analytics! Vill du jobba i kundnära team med digitalisering och modern teknik? Då kan den här rollen vara rätt för dig! Vi söker nya kollegor till samtliga kontor från Umeå i norr till Malmö i söder, så det finns möjlighet till valfri placering och givetvis möjlighet att jobba hemifrån.

Som konsult inom SAP Analytics är ditt uppdrag att bidra med kunskap och färdigheter för att våra kunder bättre ska förstå sin verksamhet. På Implema använder vi den senaste tekniken inom planering, simulering och affärsanalys, vilket är helt avgörande för att mäta och styra verksamheter till framgång. Samtidigt tycker vi att både vi och kunden utvecklas bäst om vi jobbar tillsammans. Du kommer få möjlighet att jobba med såväl seniora som juniora kollegor inom analytics och SAP applications. Som senior konsult är ditt uppdrag också att vara drivande i ett eller flera områden.

Vårt unika arbetssätt

Vi presenterar stolt Implema Way! Vårt arbetssätt vägleder kunderna steg för steg mot insikter, lösningar och kontinuerlig utveckling – och allt detta i en tidseffektiv process. Kärnan i metodiken är att snabbt, tryggt och kostnadseffektivt skapa en stabil och kraftfull plattform för att sedan stegvis utveckla och växa agilt med korta, snabba cykler.

Påverkan på den befintliga verksamheten minimeras och varje utvecklingssteg hålls på en nivå som säkrar tidplan, budget och kvalitet. Den stegvisa utvecklingen medför att investeringsbeslut tas först när kunden har bättre insikt i vad som behövs i kommande steg. Med korta tidplaner elimineras slöseri av både tid och resurser. Vi bidrar till snabbare utveckling och hjälper kunden att framtidssäkra sin affär på ett mer lönsamt och hållbart sätt.

Vi tror på att moderna affärssystem har enormt mycket funktionalitet redan i sitt standardutförande, och vi nyttjar det! Genom att undvika anpassningar och istället prioritera standards och best practices blir det enklare, snabbare och billigare att växa och utveckla affärsprocesserna över tid. Vårt fokus på standardsprocesser är också en förutsättning för många best-of-breed lösningar, tredjeparts-appar och för en snabb och effektiv digitalisering.

Relationer, utveckling och mod

Ända sedan starten har våra kundnära samarbeten format oss. Vår goda laganda bygger på ärlighet – grunden för alla hållbara relationer. Vi har byggt en företagskultur som främjar modet att utmana, viljan att utvecklas samt drivkraften att tänka nytt och testa nytt. Det är så vi tillsammans skapar värden, för oss och för våra kunder.

För oss är utmaning lika med utveckling. Vi ser hinder på vägen som framtida bedrifter. Att bli bättre på det vi gör och testa nytt är delar av vårt DNA. Tillsammans utmanar vi den traditionella konsultrollen ihop. Vi tänjer på gränserna för att utmana och utveckla våra kunder. Med laget i ryggen får du stödet att kliva utanför din trygghetszon och utrymmet att pröva din egen kreativitet. Vi tror starkt på tillit, självledarskap och laget före jaget.

Är du vår nya kollega?

För att lyckas i rollen krävs minst 3 års erfarenhet inom SAP Analytics, exempelvis klassisk BW, BW4, planering, SAC och DWC. Erfarenhet inom andra plattformar, såsom Qlik, kan också anses vara relevant. 
Du kanske har jobbat som konsult eller på verksamhets-/kundsidan där du har skaffat dig praktisk erfarenhet av SAP Analytics. 
Du är flytande i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift). 

För att trivas i rollen har du stort intresse för området och hur detta kan bidra till att stärka våra kunders konkurrenskraft. Du uppskattar att jobba nära beslutsfattare och har förmåga att få saker att hända. Du är också en dedikerad lagspelare som värnar om högkvalitativa leveranser.

Vad du bidrar med till teamet

Vi anpassar rollen efter dina unika färdigheter och kompetenser. Du har möjligheten att enbart fokusera på konsultrollen eller kombinera den med andra ansvarsområden. Det kan till exempel vara inom utbildning/mentorskap kopplat till vårt traineeprogram, projektledning, teamlead, eller stötta i våra presales-processer. Du bestämmer också om du helst fokuserar på support av befintliga kunder eller är med och leder arbetet i våra Analytics-projekt.

Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:

Implementering av SAP Analytics-lösningar
Workshopfacilitering för kunder och kollegor
Support och rådgivning till befintliga kunder vid frågor, fel och vidareutveckling
Aktivt följa SAP:s utveckling av Analytics-produkter

Vad vi erbjuder dig

Välkommen till vår dynamiska organisation, där vår kultur präglas av stolthet, engagemang och stark vilja att alltid utvecklas. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss!

Arbetsglädje, kreativitet och personlig utveckling börjar med god hälsa och att du mår bra. Därför eftersträvar vi att tillsammans med dig säkerställa en hållbar work-life balance i din tillvaro. För oss är det minst lika viktigt som att erbjuda alla våra anställda jobb i en god, hållbar arbetsmiljö med marknadsmässiga löner och förmåner.

Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige. Idag är vi 180 medarbetare och omsätter 300 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

name_location: Wise IT · Malmö, Skåne County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 6 applicants
job_description:
About the job
As an IT System Owner you will support ERP program implementation for all global functions by assisting project team and project managers in various aspects of the change management process. You have a key role in building true partnership with the client's business functions and support PowerUsers in daily work with external partners. Furthermore you will work strategically with new solutions for business definition in close cooperation with all business units as the interface between business teams and IT.

You will mainly perform tasks such as:

Support ERP program implementation and assist the organization. 
Build partnerships with the business functions and support owners in daily work. 
Work closely with external partners to ensure end-to-end operational stability. 
Coordinate system changes and drive execution of system improvements. 
Identify requirements for new and existing solutions and contribute to business case definition. 
Monitor technology trends, identify opportunities and translate project plans. 
Identify appropriate IT Training for users and coordinate external partner resources. 

To thrive in the roles as IT System Owner you are a driven and true team-player with previous experience from a similar role. You are willing to learn and challenge yourself, and you bring value by your ability to form productive relationships. Furthermore, you have a good understanding of business processes and system structures required to support those. In addition, you enjoy working in a supportive and cross-functional role.

The Client is driven by the guiding principles of Transparency, Teamwork and Commitment and it is therefore of greatest importance that you can relate to those. You will be offered a key role in a company that is on a digital transformation journey where you can make a real impact.

Important for the position: 

Experience and good knowledge with Dynamics 365
Previous experience from a similar position within IT or Business with a strong technology component. 
Experience from working cross functionally, a great understanding of business processes and knowledge of system structures. 
Preferably a bachelor's degree or equivalent in IT/Business/Digital 
 Fluent in Swedish and English. German is a plus, but not a must.

Vänligen ansök snarast med:

 Ditt uppdaterade CV
 Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
 Tillgänglighetsdatum
 En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

name_location: Implema AB · Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 9 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Implema fortsätter att växa runt om i Sverige och nu söker vi fler erfarna SAP konsulter som kan guida våra kunder på resan mot en framtidssäker affär. Hos oss får du möjlighet att jobba i kundnära team med digitalisering och teknik i framkant.

Ditt uppdrag 

I rollen som Applikationskonsult SAP har du ett helhetsansvar för samtliga faser i implementations- och utvecklingsprojekt. Du kommer få möjlighet att göra allt ifrån att sätta upp och konfigurera lösningar, specificera anpassningar och integrationer till att leda processdiskussioner och föreslå processförbättringar för våra kunder. Du kommer också att coacha, handleda och utbilda kunder, kollegor och andra konsulter inom ditt fokusområde.

Exempel på ansvarsområden:

Leda arbetet i implementations- och utvecklingsprojekt. 
Sätta upp och konfigurera lösningar, specificera anpassningar och integrationer. 
Leda processdiskussioner och föreslå processförbättringar. 
Utbilda kunder, kollegor och andra konsulter inom ditt fokusområde. 
Koordinera tredjepartsleverantörer samt integrationer till dessa. 

Är du den vi söker? 

För att lyckas i rollen har du minst 5 års yrkeserfarenhet som applikationskonsult inom SAP där du har drivit större implementations- och utvecklingsprojekt. Alternativt har du gedigen yrkeserfarenhet från en linjeroll med nära koppling till SAP, exempelvis produktionsansvarig, logistikansvarig, ekonom, systemansvarig eller projektledare. Vi tror att du har en relevant utbildning från högskola/universitet och är flytande i svenska och engelska (tal och skrift).

För att trivas i rollen brinner du för processförbättringar och förstår teknikens roll i affärsprocesser. Du har förmåga att inspirera och driva kunden framåt och föreslår lösningar som passar kunden bra. Du stimuleras av att coacha, utveckla och handleda såväl kunder som kollegor som behöver stöd i sin utveckling. För dig är det självklart att analysera och utvärdera resultat med fokus på att uppnå förbättringar. Att ständigt vara uppdaterad inom ditt kunskapsområde är en naturlig del i din yrkesmässiga personlighet likväl som du har blick för vad som fungerar väl i praktiken.

Implema erbjuder dig 

Välkommen in i en dynamisk organisation med en kultur och ett engagemang som kännetecknas av en stolthet och stark vilja att alltid driva arbetet framåt. Vi lovar dig en utmanande och varierande roll där du har möjlighet att både växa och vara med och påverka. Om du, precis som vi, är nyfiken på ny teknik och uppskattar att arbeta med tekniska lösningar som ligger i absolut framkant så kommer du att trivas hos oss! 

 

Implema är en av Sveriges ledande specialister på att snabbt implementera affärssystem baserat på marknadens ledande affärssystem SAP och Microsoft Dynamics. Med mer än 20 års erfarenhet av affärskritiska projekt guidar Implema svenska och internationella företag till effektiva och hållbara affärsprocesser och den snabbaste vägen till framtidens affärssystem. Vi vill finnas nära våra kunder och har kontor på 10 orter runt om i Sverige. Idag är vi 180 medarbetare och omsätter 300 MSEK. Vi växer och vill bli fler!

name_location: Avalanche Studios Group · Stockholm, Stockholm County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 47 applicants
job_description:
About the job
In this role, you will work closely with your discipline and use your hands-on game design and management experience as a foundation to coach and mentor individuals in their challenges and growth opportunities. Your goal is to build a strong team of designers that can handle today's challenges while meeting the company's long-term needs. As a thought leader, your high-value impact lies in the success of the team's project deliveries. You will help to communicate the company's strategies and goals and translate them into actionable goals for the craft and its members. Your experience and expertise will make you an essential resource for the team as you work together to achieve our objectives.

You can relate to and understand the challenges and opportunities of working in high-velocity teams and how to support designers in their situations and escalate issues to relevant stakeholders.

Part of your role will be to work closely with the Head of Global Craft to define and develop the craft organisation. As a leader, you will drive and support change initiatives aligned with the company's vision and goals, helping create a continuous improvement culture. You will also collaborate with team members to develop and refine working methods, ensuring that the projects operate efficiently and effectively under their leadership and that the team remains up-to-date with best practices and industry standards.

At Avalanche, we embrace being curious, bold and open to new ideas and change; we do this together and win together. A foundation in our culture where everyone is approachable and collaborative, enabling us to improve continuously and be at the forefront of the industry.

What You'll Do

Use your experience from various complex projects and organisations to coach and set best practices for designers at Avalanche Studios Group. 
Work with competence mapping to understand the short and long-term needs of the Craft. 
Work with other leaders and departments to set short and long-term strategies and goals based on company and division strategy. 
Help define the roles and responsibilities of a game designer
Drive improvement and innovation within your craft and craft organisation together with other managers within the organisation.
Work closely with projects and divisions to ensure knowledge and needs as translated into learnings and best practices.
Own craft staffing and recruitment and plan for succession and employee growth in line with divisions and projects' long-term goals. 
Drive knowledge-sharing and educational opportunities with craft members and create a strong home base for growth and knowledge-sharing
Work as a thought leader and coach to support members' growth and equip them with the tools and perspective to handle challenging situations.
Be a role model, actively work with our values, and connect them to our culture.
Apply an inclusive and servant approach to challenge the status quo and drive continuous improvement.
Create a strong team environment and sense of belonging across locations 
Work with leaders and departments to set short and long-term strategies and goals
Drive continuous improvement within your craft and craft organisation together with other managers within the Craft organisation 
Own staffing and be a stakeholder in recruitment, plan succession and employee growth in line with divisions and projects' long-term goals. 
Be a role model and actively work with values and culture
Drive knowledge-sharing and educational opportunities together with craft mentors

Who You Are

You have extensive experience leading and developing high-performing teams and complex projects, and now you want to pass your knowledge on
Excellent insight into the role of a support organisation in accelerating progress towards business goals.
Able to remain calm and provide consistent guidance in turbulent situations.
Experience in the Video Game industry or similar creative industries
Excellent in building leaders and teams 
Experience working with distributed and global teams 
Passionate about implementing process and structure whilst encouraging creative thinking within our teams?
Soft skills include curiosity, communication, collaboration, coaching, openness to change, humility, and involvement and engagement as an inclusive team player.
Experience from live service projects is a plus 
Excellent verbal and written English
Have an inclusive approach to change the status quo and meaningful improvement

Employee promise

We provide goals, instead of instructions, and the opportunity to do the best work of your career.

Our Values

At Avalanche Studios Group, we believe in worlds beyond limits, we are committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Everyone at Avalanche Studios Group has a shared responsibility to create an open and inclusive work environment where everyone is treated equally and with respect. Being part of our world is not contingent on where you’re from, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.

How To Apply

To apply for this position please register below. Apply as soon as possible as we review applications continuously. All further information is provided under non-disclosure agreement only.

We will only consider candidates who have submitted their CV and who can work from the office in Stockholm a few days a week.

name_location: Capgemini · Västerås, Vastmanland County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 55 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Capgemini ‘s Ignite Graduate Program erbjuder en individanpassad utbildning, där du utvecklas från nyutexaminerad till skicklig konsult på 12 månader. Detta är den perfekta starten på en spännande karriär, där din utvecklingskurva kommer att accelerera!

Varför ska jag arbeta för Capgemini?En bra balans mellan jobb och privatliv, fokus på hälsa och en stark och inkluderande gemenskap med 350 000 kollegor från hela världen. Detta är bara en liten del av det du får när du blir en del av Capgemini.

Vi är alla unika, en del av oss drivs av att engagera sig i hållbarhetsprojekt medan andra vill arbeta med den absolut senaste teknologin. Capgemini ‘s storlek i kombination med vårt breda utbud gör att vi kan erbjuda en mängd olika projekt som passar olika smaker och intresseområden.

Vad kan du förvänta dig av IgnITe Graduate Program?

En heltidsanställning med marknadsmässig lön samt bra förmåner
En anpassad utbildning i 12 månader utifrån vald roll eller kompetensområde
Vägledning från en mentor som agerar bollplank längs med vägen
Utmanas i spännande projekt hos stora globala kunder
Jobba nära framstående partners (bland andra Microsoft, Google, Amazon, SAP, Salesforce och Adobe) och med den senaste tekniken
Ett globalt nätverk med kunder och över 350 000 kollegor som älskar att dela med sig av sin kunskap
Du får dessutom tillgång till 250 000 kurser och certifieringar
Ha kul, då det finns olika sociala aktiviteter att välja på!

Vad krävs?Vid programmets start ska du ha en avslutad akademisk examen från relevant utbildning. Du ska också kunna kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.

Programmet Pågår

12 månader

Placeringsorter: Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Helsingborg, Västerås (du väljer den ort du föredrar att utgå ifrån i din ansökan).

Roller Inom Programmet

Här kan du läsa mer om olika roller som finns inom programmet. Till starten februari 2024 kommer vi ta in följande roller:

 Software Engineer within Digital Customer Experience 
 Software Engineer within Financial Services 
 Project Manager/Business Analyst within Digital Customer Experience (endast i Stockholm & Malmö) 
 ERP Consultant within Package Based Solutions 

Ignite Graduate Program Startar

Februari 2024

Om Rekryteringsprocessen

I samband med din ansökan kommer du att få genomföra tester. Testerna är obligatoriska i vår rekryteringsprocess och en förutsättning för att vi ska kunna gå vidare med din ansökan. Intervjuer sker löpande och kommer hållas under hösten 2023.

Om CapgeminiCapgemini är världsledande när det gäller att hjälpa kunder att driva och utveckla sina verksamheter genom den potential och de möjligheter som skapas av teknik. Koncernen har som ledstjärna att med teknikens hjälp frigöra mänsklig energi som kan användas till att bygga en hållbar och inkluderande framtid. Organisationen präglas av mångfald och ansvar och har 360 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med 55 års erfarenhet och djup branschexpertis är Capgemini en trygg partner som kan hantera hela bredden av kundernas affär, från strategi till drift, och alltid i takt med den senaste utvecklingen för innovationsområden som molnet, data, AI, uppkopplade enheter, mjukvara, digital ingenjörskonst och nya plattformar. Koncernen rapporterade globala intäkter på 22 miljarder Euro för 2022.

name_location: Arm · Lund, Skåne County, Sweden Reposted  1 day ago  · 17 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Job Overview

Do you want to experience the thrill of being part of the green and autonomous driving revolutions? Here is an excellent opportunity for a skilled hardware design engineer to join the growing GPU Functional Safety Team. If you are a forward-thinking, dedicated, creative and self-going individual that loves analysis and problem solving then we are keen to hear from you!

Responsibilities

This position provides an exciting role in the Functional Safety team in Lund, where you are involved in the micro-architectural definition, RTL design and optimization of safety mechanisms for Mali automotive graphics processors. In this creative role, you get to apply your technical and innovation skills while working on automotive GPUs that will run graphics, compute, machine learning and AI workloads for the next generation of vehicles.

This is a hands-on technical role. You will derive specifications from architecture requirements. You will specify, design and optimise HW blocks implementing safety mechanisms. You will deliver IP blocks on time, with the highest quality and at the same time meeting the products safety goals.

Candidates are encouraged to have a wide breath of design knowledge, a high degree of technical creativity and a desire to be innovative. Candidates will demonstrate skills in low power RTL implementation, including hands-on experience using innovative tools and techniques in IP development projects.

You will join a diverse team of highly motivated and creative engineers.

Required Skills And Experience

University degree in computer science, electronics engineering or microelectronics. Other science graduates will be considered if they have the right experience.
Experience of RTL design for GPUs, CPUs or DSP.
Broad project experience, having owned and carried out design and implementation of sophisticated units or sub-systems, from specification to sign-off.
Experience in metric driven design space exploration, including being able to evaluate and compare different solutions, picking out the one that best fits power, performance and area requirements.
Ability to work with a high level of independence and schedule your own work and tasks.
You communicate effectively in spoken and written English.
Previous experience or strong curiosity about Functional Safety.

“Nice To Have” Skills and Experience 

You should have experience with high level programming in languages such as C/C++.
Being familiar with verification techniques is an advantage.
Previous experience designing functional safety mechanisms within an ISO26262 context.
Experience in project planning and resource allocation.

In Return 

All Arm employees are provided with training to succeed in their respective roles. As well as a friendly and high-performance working environment, Arm offers a competitive benefits package in Sweden including RSU, private medical insurance, 30 days of annual leave, sabbatical, supplementary pension, wellness benefits. At Arm Lund we have a hybrid working approach where we offer people the flexibility to work part of their time from home and part of the time from the office.



Accommodations at Arm

At Arm, we want our people to Do Great Things. If you need support or an accommodation to Be Your Brilliant Self during the recruitment process, please email accommodations@arm.com . To note, by sending us the requested information, you consent to its use by Arm to arrange for appropriate accommodations. All accommodation requests will be treated with confidentiality, and information concerning these requests will only be disclosed as necessary to provide the accommodation. Although this is not an exhaustive list, examples of support include breaks between interviews, having documents read aloud or office accessibility. Please email us about anything we can do to accommodate you during the recruitment process.

Equal Opportunities at Arm

Arm is an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal opportunities are available to all applicants and colleagues. We are a diverse organization of dedicated and innovative individuals, and don’t discriminate on the basis of any characteristic.

Hybrid Working at Arm

Arm’s hybrid approach to working is centred around flexibility, where we split our time between the office and other locations to get our work done. We empower groups/teams to determine their hybrid working pattern, with an expected minimum attendance in the office of 20% per month, depending on the work, level of experience and team’s needs. In some cases, the flexibility we can offer is limited by local legal, regulatory, tax, or other considerations, and where this is the case, we will collaborate with you to find the best solution.

name_location: Grafana Labs · EMEA Reposted  1 day ago  · 229 applicants
job_description:
About the job
Make a difference.

The Solutions Engineering team are the customer facing product experts. The team enables Grafana Labs worldwide growth by educating potential and existing customers to ensure that they are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, hands on enablement, presentations, technical evaluations and ongoing interaction. We partner closely with our Sales team to help qualify and close opportunities. The Solutions Engineering team is one of the primary routes of communication from our customers to the Product Management and Engineering teams.

A Solutions Engineer is able to really listen to a prospect or customer, understand their requirements, ask the right questions to extract as much information as required and translate all that into a solution with Grafana Labs technology. They are the bridge between the highly technical engineering folks here at Grafana Labs, our customers and our Sales team.

Your Impact

Partner with our Sales team to articulate the overall Grafana value proposition, vision and strategy to customers
Own the technical engagement with customers and help close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill and credibility
Deliver product and technical presentations to potential and existing customers
Effectively communicate with customers and internal teams to provide feedback on our products and the competitive landscape
Drive product conversations based on need and problems with customers
Work with the team to enhance documentation, write blog posts, record videos, contribute knowledge base articles and create other public or private enablement material


What would make you a good fit for this role?

Must be located in DACH
10 years of technical pre-sales experience, ideally with Open Source technologies, or in the Metrics/Monitoring space
Be open to various and complex assignments, this will require strong judgment, collaboration, and leadership
You will need first class written and oral communication skills to collaborate with our remote-first internal teams and with our worldwide customers. You will need to be able to skillfully articulate our value proposition and the technical advantages of our products
You love solving technical challenges and thrive on bringing creative solutions to our customers
You should have a technical mindset and a desire to grow technically. Great candidates may be a recent grad of a coding bootcamp or have previous post-sales or engineering experience–we are excited to see what unique experiences and skill sets you bring to the table! 


About Grafana Labs: There are more than 950,000 active installations of Grafana around the globe, monitoring everything from beehives to climate change in the Alps. The instantly recognizable dashboards have been spotted everywhere from a NASA launch and Minecraft HQ to Wimbledon and the Tour de France. Grafana Labs also helps companies including Bloomberg, JPMorgan Chase, and eBay manage their observability strategies with full-stack offerings that can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud, or self-managed with Grafana Enterprise Stack. The Grafana stack has grown to include four other open source projects, Grafana Loki (for logs), Grafana Tempo (for traces), Grafana Mimir (for metrics), and Grafana OnCall (for on-call management).

Benefits: For more information about the perks and benefits of working at Grafana, please check out our careers page.

Equal Opportunity Employer: At Grafana Labs we’re building a company where a diverse mix of talented people want to come, stay, and do their best work. We know that our company runs on the hard work and the dedication of our passionate and creative employees. If you're excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways.

We will recruit, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, disability, age, veteran status, and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us different and unique. We believe that equality and diversity builds a strong organisation and we’re working hard to make sure that’s the foundation of our organisation as we grow.

For information about how your personal data is used once you’ve applied to a job, check out our privacy policy.

About the job
This role is an opportunity for an EU resident technologist with a passion for Linux and Cloud to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.

Cloud Engineer

Cloud engineers architect and run the leading cloud technologies on the market today and in the future. This includes OpenStack and Kubernetes for multi-cloud environments as well as automated infrastructure and service orchestration. The dedicated cloud engineer works directly with a Canonical customer to understand their cloud needs and help shape their cloud strategy.

As a member of the team you will gain experience using a broad range of cloud technologies. Canonical clouds include future upgrades meaning you aren’t stuck working with old solutions. Canonical is a technology agnostic cloud leader, incorporating new solutions like Kubernetes as they become available staying up to date with the best open-source offerings.

About Canonical

Canonical is a growing, international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu -- the world’s #1 cloud operating system. Our mission is to realize the potential of free software in the lives of individuals and organisations. Our services are helping businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We offer:
100% Work-from-home w/i the EU
Learning and Development
Competitive Salary
Recognition Rewards
Annual Leave
Priority Pass for travel
Flexible working option

Requirements
Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent degree
Software Development experience and familiarity with Python
Demonstrated drive for continual learning
Experience working directly with customers

Nice to haves
Experience with OpenStack or Kubernetes deployment or operation

We hope that you’ll join us in helping to shape and build the future of free software together.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

Canonical believes a diverse workforce enhances our ability to deliver world class software and services which meet the world’s computing needs. We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
